title: @Riot Petition for very important ARAMs change
body: When mustachioed Poros explode, the resultant Poros should also have mustaches.

replies.body:
- Make ARAM use entire champ pool
- Do something about dodgers (low priority queue or keeping the same champ after  dodge)
- Nerf sona (70% winrate is a bit too high, even for a funmode)
- baby-poro Mustaches.

{{champion:202}} With those 4 changes, ARAM would be perfected.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Poro,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-09-02T23:21:09.208+0000)
>
> - Make ARAM use entire champ pool
> - Do something about dodgers (low priority queue or keeping the same champ after  dodge)
> - Nerf sona (70% winrate is a bit too high, even for a funmode)
> - baby-poro Mustaches.
> 
> {{champion:202}} With those 4 changes, ARAM would be perfected.

Get the fuck out of here with that shit. Not everyone wants to be forced to play cancer like Lux. Some people actually have dignity.

I don't understand what you're saying. With the entire champion pool used, it would be less likely to get a specific champ. Also, with an increased number of rerolls and ability to swap champs with any ally you'd be able to avoid playing certain champions that you really dislike.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Poro,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2016-09-03T00:36:23.656+0000)
>
> I don't understand what you're saying. With the entire champion pool used, it would be less likely to get a specific champ. Also, with an increased number of rerolls and ability to swap champs with any ally you'd be able to avoid playing certain champions that you really dislike.

I never really thought of that. Yeah, you WOULD get more rerolls. I just don't like to play certain champs, and when I say certain champs, I mean EVERYONE I don't own. I already have everyone I want, and I enjoy playing all of them in ARAM, although I do prefer champions like Vel'Koz, Yorick, and Kog'Maw (Well, before they gutted AP Kog'Maw). Seriously, a good AP Kog'Maw was the single most terrifying thing in the entire game.

Part of the reason I got so upset though was because I've seen WAY too many posts saying how they want all champions to be available in ARAM, and it was beginning to really get to me. Especially since the OP didn't mention it at all, and you seemed to bring it up out of relatively nowhere.

> although I do prefer champions like Vel'Koz, Yorick, and Kog'Maw (Well, before they gutted AP Kog'Maw). Seriously, **a good AP Kog'Maw was the single most terrifying thing in the entire game.**

LOL, you say you don't want to play cancer like Lux, but it's okay that you prefer to play Vel'Koz who's not that different in ARAM? I mean, I like playing Vel'koz in ARAM, but he's just as annoying as Lux. **And this is the reason we want all champs allowed. You are glad that merely anything that pops up from the "random" selection will be viable for you and you'll have easy fun with easy champs while others will have to somehow go through the 20-minutes suffering. We're glad YOU are the only one who should be having fun as you've already customized it that way for you.**

But you know, there are people who bought some champs before ARAM was even a thing, before they started playing it or discovered it or bought some champs as test. I suppose as punishment the mode should become somehow automatically less viable for them because reasons.

Vel'Koz is definitely a power-pick in ARAM, but he requires you to actually AIM your skillshots, unlike Lux. Her skillshots are easier to land than Warwick's fucking ult. So no, he's not as bad as Lux, LOL.

Also, tell me again, what's the reason you want all champions to be allowed in ARAM? To force people into playing champions that they don't enjoy? Has it ever occurred to people like you that people want to play a champion they actually BOUGHT, and that they bought that champion because they ENJOY playing as them? Of course, this isn't the case for everyone, but from what I've seen, it's the case for the majority of ARAM players.

And, contrary to what you think, not every single damn champion I play in ARAM is a poke mage. I play my fair share of tanks, fighters, and hell, even supports sometimes, too. Hell, sometimes I don't even perform well with mages, such as Fiddlesticks. I simply enjoy playing them, and that's why I bought them.

Also, yeah, there are people who bought champs before ARAM was even a thing, or before they started playing ARAM, such as me. I started playing ARAM only a little less than a year after I started playing League as a whole. But here's the catch: I bought champions that I enjoy playing as in ANY gamemode. If you get a champion you don't enjoy in ARAM, that's YOUR fault, since you're the person who bought that champion in the first place. If other people get a champions that they enjoy, then that's good for them, because they bought a champion they actually enjoy!

And no, before you say anything, I DON'T only play mages in ARAM. In fact, I enjoy playing champions like Udyr, Renekton, Warwick, ect. In ARAM. In fact, Warwick is one of my favorite champions to play in that gamemode.

> Vel'Koz is definitely a power-pick in ARAM, but he requires you to actually AIM your skillshots, unlike Lux. Her skillshots are easier to land than Warwick's fucking ult. So no, he's not as bad as Lux, LOL.

I know you are exaggorating for effect and try to take it less seriously but this is just bullsh!t considering Lux is one of few champs, maybe the only one, who has to AIM her friendy shield ability :D . Like even her shield isn't point-and-click (because it can affect multiple targets, so it has reason, just sayin'). You have to deal with the fact she must aim Q, she must aim ult and it's pretty dodgeable If you pay attention to game, she must aim her shield. The only ability that's pretty easy to land while still rewarding you with a lot of damage is her E (I think). Finally, Lux must take the distance, risk and time to basicattack you to trigger her passive to deal her full damage bounty.

Meanwhile Vel'Koz can only complain his E is harder to predict and use since it has more dodgeframe while affecting smaller area and feels like dealing less damage. But it offers much better CC. His Q can hit more targets and can reach further than Lux's Q if you can use the geometry mechanic, his W pierces through targets and his ult also pierces through targets. To trigger his Passive which not only feels more rewarding than Lux's but also deals true damage, you just need to land three instances of damage from abilities which isn't that hard If you play Vel a lot (I try to main him).

Both Lux and Vel are annoying in the fact they need to land one ability (similar to Xerath) and they can trigger their combo and easily use ult effectively without much trying. For Vel it's E, for Lux it's Q.

> Also, tell me again, what's the reason you want all champions to be allowed in ARAM? To force people into playing champions that they don't enjoy?** Has it ever occurred to people like you that people want to play a champion they actually BOUGHT, and that they bought that champion because they ENJOY playing as them?** Of course, this isn't the case for everyone, but from what I've seen, it's the case for the majority of ARAM players.

1) No people want it because it brings fairness into game. Buying a champ that you enjoy playing and is viable on Summoner Rift but is nearly useless in ARAM is automatically making the MODE less viable for you. The more champs like that, the less viable.

2) You would want that, too, trust me. You, unfortunately, obviously encounter more people like us, who buy champions not specifically for ARAM. But should you encounter Malphite, Lux, Veigar, Annie, Garen or Katarina in groups of at least three in nearly every game, making it decided before first minute, and all that because those players at the MMR you'd reach would buy only these champs to play them in ARAM, you'd feel how the "fun" mode turns unfun pretty quickly.

**3) You'd still be able to play them. This system might go hand by hand with easier access to Rerolls and more Rerolls. Also, you would be sure that should your teammate have the champ you want, you are guaranteed to trade with them as they will certainly have the champ you have. Imagine someone can't play the champ they want because the other person doesn't own the one they have so they can't trade...**

> And, contrary to what you think, not every single damn champion I play in ARAM is a poke mage. I play my fair share of tanks, fighters, and hell, even supports sometimes, too. Hell, sometimes I don't even perform well with mages, such as Fiddlesticks. I simply enjoy playing them, and that's why I bought them.

And three kudos to you, but not everyone sets their accounts like this.

> But here's the catch: I bought champions that I enjoy playing as in ANY gamemode. If you get a champion you don't enjoy in ARAM, that's YOUR fault, since you're the person who bought that champion in the first place.

There's difference between enjoying the kit of said champ (like just Evelynn) and enjoying to play the champ in certain area with certain objectives against certain meta (playing Evelynn against team full of Juggernauts and Pokers isn't that much fun).

> And no, before you say anything, I DON'T only play mages in ARAM. In fact, I enjoy playing champions like Udyr, Renekton, Warwick, ect. In ARAM.

Ironically the only champ of these you've listed that seems unviable in ARAM is Udyr. Especially Warwick may have hard to useless early game but If you have one more tank with you and bursters that finish the job you initiate, you can get early gold from assists, build tankish and end up still soaking much damage while dealing enough damage. His main problem is lack of gapclosing which is easily fixed with Snowball or Ghost.
can you imagine if you had to put up with mr eye laser ult in aram? oh god the nonstop poke and ult penta kills.

The problem with the current system of ARAM is that if you want to fully enjoy the gamemode (guaranteed a champ that you like), you have to focus your account entirely on ARAM. I own many champions that I don't like in ARAM but do like or did like to play in Summoner's Rift. Volibear and Udyr for example both have been my main jungler at some point. But I don't want to play a 5v5 dodgeball game with them while 7/9 other players got a ranged poke champ. I just don't think it's right to have your account 'screwed forever' in a gamemode because you have purchased something. There are still champs that I'd like to buy for summoner's rift but refuse to do so because their winrate in ARAM are horrible.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Poro,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-03T12:44:38.053+0000)
>
> The problem with the current system of ARAM is that if you want to fully enjoy the gamemode (guaranteed a champ that you like), you have to focus your account entirely on ARAM. I own many champions that I don't like in ARAM but do like or did like to play in Summoner's Rift. Volibear and Udyr for example both have been my main jungler at some point. But I don't want to play a 5v5 dodgeball game with them while 7/9 other players got a ranged poke champ. I just don't think it's right to have your account 'screwed forever' in a gamemode because you have purchased something. There are still champs that I'd like to buy for summoner's rift but refuse to do so because their winrate in ARAM are horrible.

Thanks for getting your point across without sounding like an asshole, unlike Nostormo over there.

Unfortunately, I don't see to eye to eye with you. From my perspective, you don't have to focus your account on ARAM to guarantee a champion that you enjoy. You just have to buy the champions you enjoy playing as, and avoid buying the ones that you don't enjoy. It seems to me that you only find a champion enjoyable if you can destroy everyone with him.
That feel when a person complains about being forced to play a champ in a game mode where you are forced to play a champ. Just don't play aram if you can't handle the random.

> [{quoted}](name=Loopien,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=000000010001,timestamp=2016-09-03T11:54:34.755+0000)
>
> That feel when a person complains about being forced to play a champ in a game mode where you are forced to play a champ. Just don't play aram if you can't handle the random.

Lol? You're supposed to be forced to play champions you actually CARE about, not champions that you fucking hate. That's why people buy champions that they like, and DON'T buy champions that they don't like.

It's not rocket science.

I believe the game mode is called All Random All Mid, not All Semi-Random All Mid.

Some people also have earned enough IP that they started buying champions that seem interesting instead of ones with kits that they've learned.
I myself main mages mid, but I also own Kalista, Fiora, Rek'Sai, and Rengar.  I bought them because they have fun/interesting kits, though I have yet to properly learn them all.  Should I be punished for buying champions that seem interesting?

Making ARAM truly random would show peoples' skills at the game in general, rather than just a half dozen champions.  It would also function to introduce players to champion styles they haven't played yet, but may end up enjoying.

The basic purpose of ARAM was to have people play out of their comfort zone anyway, with no set meta, so this would be closer to that ideal as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Carnage068,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-09-03T00:27:43.177+0000)
>
> Get the fuck out of here with that shit. Not everyone wants to be forced to play cancer like Lux. Some people actually have dignity.

ARAM account user detected.

> [{quoted}](name=MrNuclearPumpkin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=000000010002,timestamp=2016-09-03T13:48:39.579+0000)
>
> ARAM account user detected.

Nope, sorry. I'm simply a person who buys the champions they enjoy playing as.

> With those 4 changes, ARAM would be perfected.

http://img02.deviantart.net/2f4e/i/2016/038/f/7/jhin_meme_by_mikouchan-d9qyb6a.png

Nerfing Sona just for ARAM is ridiculous. 
Yes yes Sona main here, but Summoner's rift is the main game mode of LoL. Sona definitely deserves further nerfs for SR, but nerfing her to the point where she's healthy in ARAM would be nerfing her to oblivion for SR. Sona is THE champ for ARAM (auras for 5v5, decent poke, constant heals, AOE stun). Disabling her would be a better option,
I'm talking about map-specific nerfs. Ana lternative is deleting her from ARAM. But at 70% winrate (second highest is 63%) she's the biggest outlier in any gamemode ever.

I dont know how others would feel about this,but I would like to have a slim chance to be able to play the same champ on both teams during the same game.

We already have over 130champions and give the possibility of that would be interesting to me,not to mentiom it would rare.
what would you want nerfed exactly on sona to make her in a better place for aram
Cooldowns, shields and/or aura buffs.

Cooldowns are sorta her entire playstyle. They have to be low in order to get her power chord effects. Her aura buffs are the issue in aram because they affect all 5 of her allies at all times, something that never happens on SR.

nerf only sona ? 

{{champion:115}}  {{champion:26}} {{champion:9}} are broken in ARAM as well

add these three to the list otherwise we won't have 4 champs that need an ARAM exclusive nerf

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Poro,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AIVbIJGr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-09-02T23:21:09.208+0000)
>
> - Make ARAM use entire champ pool
> - Do something about dodgers (low priority queue or keeping the same champ after  dodge)
> - Nerf sona (70% winrate is a bit too high, even for a funmode)
> - baby-poro Mustaches.
> 
> {{champion:202}} With those 4 changes, ARAM would be perfected.

You don't need to nerf Sona. Her healing is the problem, but healing is already reduced on ARAM. You just need to remove Athene's Unholy Grail from the map. That item's introduction is what made healing supports go out of control. 

Maybe ban Windspeakers as well.
sona was aram cancer since forever ,bullshit sona
Preach. I dislike ARAM a lot, mainly because of the people who DON'T think it's a funmode.
Nerf Veigar for ARAM.

Also, make Poro Snax purchasable in the shop.

Secondly, I'd really like to see some items restored (yes, DFG is one of them).

AND REMOVE THE MARK-ABILITY!!!
Seriously, in all my 5000 ARAM matches (at the time of its release), I had never felt the need for something like mark.

It's usability is ridiculous, as you can dodge EVERY ability with it. No shields can stop it (Anivia Wall of Ice, Yasuo windwall - which can still stop a tidal wave - Sivir Spellshield, Nocturne's Cloak of Shadows...or whatever the name is), and it even got enough damage to make it a finishing move.

No, let the Mark/Poro Toss stay with Legend of the Poro King, and leave regular ARAM out it! And let us buy more Poro Snax at will.

And yes, make ARAM dodgers regret their existance! 
_Good thing for them I'm not in charge of dispensing justice over that._

You can dodge the snowball. Before Mark/Dash, it was a contest of who had the best poke. If you received a champ like udyr or volibear the best thing you could do was act as if the game was dodge-ball and maybe your teammates somehow carry you because you'd be too far behind to even be relevant when the rest reaches lategame. Granted that other changes have been made to make it better for fighters, they're still in a weak position. Yes, snowball is OP on some champs like Alistar and Galio, but it does help out way more underpowered fighters.

When you got champions like Udyr and Volibear, you had to have skill with the champion. Guardian's Horn in tandem with Flash + Distortion boot enchantment made plays still possible. It was all I ever needed.

I have never used Mark (except just once, on release, to try it out), and I refuse to do so, and I still don't mind getting Volibear.

Mark does half the job for you, and makes the skill it would otherwise take to get close completely out of the equation. It's outright boring for me.

When I play ARAM, I play with the mindset of letting it be a teamfight on the Summoner's Rift...we don't have Mark on Summoner's Rift, so using Mark feels like cheating to me. And so back to why I don't or won't use it myself in ARAM.
The snowball was a genius idea. It actally gave melee characters a way to gap close and actually be useful. Before that, ARAM was dominated by ranged champions.

Don't you think I have experienced this frequently in all my ARAM matches?
~5000 ARAM matches, mind you, when Mark was introduced. 45 matches away from 6000 now.

Did I find it fair that the no-gapcloser team were likely to be the losers before even the game began? Of course I didn't. But I also knew the time would come where the tables were turned, and my team would be on the dealing end of things. And so I sucked it up and accepted it.

It was ARAM, and it was the way of the game mode. I didn't mind.

And when we did have some fighters/tanks/brusiers with gapclosers, and the individual skill level were high enough to not throw the game by excessively feeding too early, more often than not we would win those matches, come late game.

It was 12 minutes of frustration, before an 8 minute steamroll and what would feel like a hard-earned victory.

These days, you can make impossible plays with anyone. Total BS, in my view. 

If Mark is to stay, I'd make a couple changes: remove the damage, and make it exclusively available to melee champions.
Ranged champions usually got some AoE-abilities that, in the spirit of the game, makes something like Mark completely redundant.

My argument:

It's a fun mode.. Shhhhh

>It's a fun mode.

Yeah, that's what I'm saying - else I wouldn't be playing it so much. But I want it to be fun for everybody (if ever that was even possible). 

Oh well, one can always dream.
Do please feel free to keep downvoting - if people can't come with any counter-arguments, my case stands.

this is gonna snowball games too ghard
riot will never implement it
Baby mustache poros are NEED! :D
I get Lux or Teemo in 90% of my games. This is not healthy.
I get a sona in 90% of my games, wanna swap? I'd like to have at least a slim chance of winning.
Disliked cuz gameplay. Seriously, gameplay=balance,  m&g=jokes
But this is a serious suggestion on a non-serious feature. It's still a suggestion on a feature, not just a joke.

Gameplay is about balance and balance suggestions.

Miscellaneous is about random things **or** some minor changes like this.
I agree. This has always bothered me.
:o I thought it did that already. Does it not do that anymore?

Bots in ARAM are my serious problem with the game mode. At least in EUNE it really feels like inhumane beings march down the lane and feed. They usually start with boots and only buy complete items like Banshee's Veil or Void Staff.

i am chalengeerrrr!!!
{{champion:63}} {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
